history.content:
To be honest, I would just go straight to 61A. All 61A requires is familiarity with programming (a summer course in Java should be more than enough). The difficulty comes in trying to think like a programmer, and in this sense, Data 8 and CS 10 don't help if you already know how to program. 61A emphasizes a very formal style of thinking about programming, which Data 8 and CS 10 don't beat into you. I would just take the rest of the summer to learn some Python, and you should be more than prepared.

Data 8 is a class that is more about statistical analysis using Python, so it only helps because it exposes you to Python a little bit, but not nearly to the same rigor as 61A.


--------

If you are completely new to programming (which sounds like doesn’t really apply to you), then CS 10. Else I would highly recommend taking Data 8 instead. Many people jump straight into CS 61A with 0 to a little (APCS) knowledge, but I also know many people who do take data 8 to prepare for 61a. You might also enjoy data science and decide to also major/minor that too!

--------

CS 10 is more similar to CS 61A since Data 8 is about statistical analysis. Nevertheless, Data 8 is a prerequisite of Stat 140 and Data 100 (Data 100 can count for one cs upper division course), although you can skip data 8 for them if you are strong in programming and statistical analysis.

Many people jump straight into CS 61A with 0 to a little (APCS) knowledge, but I also know many people who do take data 8 to prepare for 61a. You might also enjoy data science and decide to also major/minor that too!

Many people jump straight into CS 61A with 0 to a little (APCS) knowledge, but I also know many people who do take data 8 to prepare for 61a. You might also enjoy data science and decide to also major/minor that too!

Hello everyone! 

I am an incoming freshman intending to study CS at Cal and I am having trouble choosing between CS 10 and Data 8 in preparation for CS 61A. I have a little bit of programming experience (i have taken an introductory summer course in Java before) but I think I will need to take another one at Berkeley to refresh my memory. Which one would you guys recommend, CS 10 or Data 8? 

Thanks!
history.subject: CS 10 or Data 8
